active_learning.discussion_prompt: In the SaaS shared responsibility model, debate whether the cloud provider or customer primarily bears responsibility for GDPR compliance on data encryption at rest. Use examples from multi-tenancy challenges and reference potential fines up to 4% of global annual revenue to support your position.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator specializing in university-level cybersecurity education. Generate 25 high-quality flashcards on 'GDPR Compliance' in the context of SaaS Compliance and Governance (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Cloud Service Models > Software as a Service (SaaS) > SaaS Compliance and Governance > GDPR Compliance). Integrate voter consensus (85.7% approval): completeness on standards (ISO 27001, SOC 2, NIST, CIS Controls, CSA STAR tied to GDPR), SaaS challenges (data residency, multi-tenancy, shared responsibility, DPAs), pedagogy (Bloom's objectives), scaffolding (4 layers), concept map, big picture (fines to 4% revenue), and assessments with feedback. Use this research context: GDPR core concepts (personal data incl. indirect identifiers, controller/processor, processing, breach); 7 principles (lawfulness/fairness/transparency, purpose limitation, data minimisation, accuracy, storage limitation, integrity/confidentiality, accountability – emphasize security); ICO guidance on technical measures. Structure content per scaffolding: - Layer 1 Foundation: Definitions, 7 principles, big picture. - Layer 2 Components: Roles, concept map (GDPR Compliance → Principles/Roles/SaaS apps), frameworks. - Layer 3 Implementation: SaaS specifics (DPAs, checklists). - Layer 4 Integration: Standards integration, cloud ties. Align to these Bloom's objectives: [insert full list from JSON above]. Incorporate active learning hooks: e.g., cards prompting application to scenarios/discussions. Output EXACTLY 25 flashcards in JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '... (incl. rationale, misconception fix, SaaS tie)', 'blooms_level': '...', 'layer': 1-4, 'tags': ['GDPR', etc.]}}, ...]. Follow flashcard schema strictly: Varied fronts (Q&A 30%, cloze 30%, MCQ 40%). MCQs: 4 options (A-D), bold correct in answer. Distractors: Plausible misconceptions (e.g., role confusion, fine %, timelines). Explanations: 2-4 sentences with feedback/remediation. Balance: ~6 cards/layer, span objectives. Ensure educational depth, no fluff.
